001package io.github.ai4ci.flow;
002
003import org.slf4j.Logger;
004import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;
005
006import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutableOutbreakBaseline;
007import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutableOutbreakState;
008import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutablePersonBaseline;
009import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutablePersonState;
010import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ModifiableOutbreak;
011import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ModifiablePerson;
012import io.github.ai4ci.abm.Outbreak;
013import io.github.ai4ci.config.execution.ExecutionConfiguration;
014import io.github.ai4ci.config.setup.SetupConfiguration;
015import io.github.ai4ci.flow.builders.AbstractModelBuilder;
016import io.github.ai4ci.flow.builders.DefaultModelBuilder;
017import io.github.ai4ci.util.Cloner;
018import io.github.ai4ci.util.Sampler;
019
020/**
021 * Builder that orchestrates setup, baselining and initialisation of an
022 * {@link Outbreak} instance for an experiment.
023 *
024 * <p>
025 * The {@code ExecutionBuilder} performs the three main phases required to turn
026 * configuration objects into a runnable outbreak: setup, model baselining and
027 * runtime initialisation. It delegates stage behaviour to a model builder which
028 * implements {@link AbstractModelBuilder}.
029 *
030 * <p>
031 * Important note: at present the implementation is hardwired to use
032 * {@link DefaultModelBuilder} (see the constructor). The intended design is for
033 * {@code ExecutionBuilder} to support compositional substitution of alternative
034 * builders (for example subclasses of {@code DefaultModelBuilder} that mix
035 * different default interfaces). The file includes clear TODO comments showing
036 * the places to change to support factory injection, ServiceLoader discovery or
037 * selection from {@link SetupConfiguration}.
038 *
039 * @author Rob Challen
040 */
041public class ExecutionBuilder {
042
043        static Logger log = LoggerFactory.getLogger(ExecutionBuilder.class);
044
045        /**
046         * Build an outbreak for an experiment from the supplied setup and execution
047         * configurations and an optional URN base string.
048         *
049         * @param setupConfig the setup configuration defining the population and
050         *                    network structure
051         * @param execConfig  the execution configuration defining runtime priors and
052         *                    parameters
053         * @param urnBase     an optional string to prefix the outbreak URN with (for
054         *                    example to distinguish different experiments or
055         *                    scenarios); if null the URN will be based on the setup
056         *                    and execution configuration alone
057         * @return a fully built and initialised outbreak ready for simulation
058         */
059        public static Outbreak buildExperiment(
060                        SetupConfiguration setupConfig, ExecutionConfiguration execConfig,
061                        String urnBase
062        ) {
063
064                ExecutionBuilder experiment = new ExecutionBuilder(setupConfig);
065                experiment.setupOutbreak(urnBase);
066                experiment.baselineModel(execConfig);
067                experiment.initialiseStatus(execConfig);
068                return experiment.build();
069        }
070
071        /**
072         * Utility method to check free memory in GB. This can be used to estimate
073         * the size of the outbreak that can be built without running out of memory.
074         * Note that this is a very rough estimate and actual memory usage will
075         * depend on many factors including the JVM's memory management and the
076         * specific data structures used in the outbreak model.
077         *
078         * @return the estimated free memory in gigabytes
079         */
080        public static double freeMem() {
081                Runtime runtime = Runtime.getRuntime();
082                long allocatedMemory = runtime.totalMemory() - runtime.freeMemory();
083                // allocatedMemory = allocatedMemory > maxMem ? maxMem : allocatedMemory;
084                return ((double) runtime.maxMemory() - allocatedMemory)
085                                / (1024 * 1024 * 1024);
086        }
087
088        SetupConfiguration setupConfig;
089
090        ModifiableOutbreak outbreak;
091        AbstractModelBuilder modelBuilder;
092
093        ExecutionBuilder(SetupConfiguration setupConfig) {
094                this.setupConfig = setupConfig;
095                // NOTE: currently hardwired to DefaultModelBuilder. To support
096                // compositional substitution of builders consider one of the following
097                // approaches:
098                // - Accept an AbstractModelBuilder (or a factory) as a constructor
099                // parameter so callers can inject a custom builder implementation.
100                // - Use a simple factory that chooses a builder implementation based
101                // on values in SetupConfiguration (for example a "builderType"
102                // string), allowing subclassed DefaultModelBuilder variants to be
103                // selected without changing this class.
104                // - Use ServiceLoader or a dependency injection framework to discover
105                // available AbstractModelBuilder implementations at runtime and
106                // select one according to configuration.
107                // - Introduce a ModelBuilderFactory interface responsible for creating
108                // builder instances; wire the factory via configuration or DI.
109                //
110                // The immediate technical change required is to replace the direct
111                // construction below with a call to the chosen factory/selection
112                // mechanism and store the resulting AbstractModelBuilder in
113                // `this.modelBuilder`.
114                this.modelBuilder = new DefaultModelBuilder();
115                this.outbreak = Outbreak.createOutbreakStub();
116        }
117
118        void baselineModel(ExecutionConfiguration execConfig) {
119                this.outbreak.setUrn(
120                                this.outbreak.getUrn() + ":" + execConfig.getName() + ":"
121                                                + execConfig.getReplicate()
122                );
123                Sampler sampler = Sampler.getSampler(this.outbreak.getUrn());
124                this.outbreak.setExecutionConfiguration(execConfig);
125
126                this.outbreak.getPeople().parallelStream().forEach(p -> {
127                        Sampler sampler2 = Sampler.getSampler(this.outbreak.getUrn());
128                        if (p instanceof ModifiablePerson) {
129                                ModifiablePerson m = (ModifiablePerson) p;
130
131                                ImmutablePersonBaseline.Builder builder = m.initialisedBaseline()
132                                                ? ImmutablePersonBaseline.builder().from(m.getBaseline())
133                                                : ImmutablePersonBaseline.builder();
134
135                                // NOTE: baselining delegates to the current modelBuilder. If we
136                                // want to support alternative per-person baselining behaviour
137                                // via compositional builders then ensure the selected
138                                // AbstractModelBuilder provides the desired baselining
139                                // implementation (eg via mixing different DefaultPersonBaseliner
140                                // interfaces). Subclass selection or factory wiring is required.
141                                this.modelBuilder.doBaselinePerson(builder, p, sampler2);
142                                m.setBaseline(builder.build());
143                        }
144                });
145
146                // Calibrate R0 to a baseline transmission probability
147                ImmutableOutbreakBaseline.Builder builder = this.outbreak
148                                .initialisedBaseline()
149                                                ? ImmutableOutbreakBaseline.builder()
150                                                                .from(this.outbreak.getBaseline())
151                                                : ImmutableOutbreakBaseline.builder();
152
153                this.modelBuilder.doBaselineOutbreak(builder, this.outbreak, sampler);
154                this.outbreak.setBaseline(builder.build());
155
156        }
157
158        /**
159         * Return the built outbreak. This method should be called after setup,
160         * baselining and initialisation have been completed. It checks that the
161         * outbreak is fully initialised before returning it; if the outbreak is not
162         * initialised a RuntimeException is thrown to indicate that the build
163         * process has not been completed successfully. After returning the outbreak,
164         * the internal reference is set to null to prevent further modifications and
165         * to allow for garbage collection.
166         *
167         * @return the fully built and initialised outbreak ready for simulation
168         */
169        public Outbreak build() {
170                if (!this.outbreak.isInitialized())
171                        throw new RuntimeException("Not initialised");
172                Outbreak tmp = this.outbreak;
173                this.outbreak = null;
174                return tmp;
175        }
176
177        /**
178         * Create a copy of this builder with the same setup configuration and a copy
179         * of the outbreak. The outbreak copy can be a shallow or deep copy depending
180         * on the estimated size of the outbreak; if estSize is negative a deep copy
181         * is performed, otherwise a shallow copy is used to save time and memory.
182         *
183         * This is used by the parallel execution framework to create separate
184         * builder instances for each parallel thread while sharing the same setup
185         * configuration. The outbreak copy allows each thread to work with its own
186         * outbreak instance without interference, while the setup configuration can
187         * be shared since it is immutable. {@link Cloner} is used to perform the
188         * copying; it should be noted that the efficiency of the copy operation will
189         * depend on the size of the outbreak and the type of copy performed. For
190         * large outbreaks, a shallow copy may be more efficient, while for smaller
191         * outbreaks a deep copy may be acceptable.
192         *
193         * @param estSize an estimate of the outbreak size used to determine the type
194         *                of copy; if negative a deep copy is performed, otherwise a
195         *                shallow copy is used
196         * @return a new ExecutionBuilder instance with the same setup configuration
197         *         and a copy of the outbreak
198         */
199        public ExecutionBuilder copy(long estSize) {
200                ExecutionBuilder tmp = new ExecutionBuilder(this.setupConfig);
201                if (estSize < 0) {
202                        tmp.outbreak = Cloner.copy(this.outbreak);
203                } else {
204                        tmp.outbreak = Cloner.copy(this.outbreak, estSize);
205                }
206                return tmp;
207        }
208
209        void initialiseStatus(ExecutionConfiguration execConfig) {
210                Sampler sampler = Sampler.getSampler(this.outbreak.getUrn());
211
212                ImmutableOutbreakState.Builder builder = ImmutableOutbreakState.builder();
213                if (this.outbreak.initialisedCurrentState()) {
214                        builder.from(this.outbreak.getCurrentState());
215                }
216
217                builder.setEntity(this.outbreak).setTime(0);
218
219                // NOTE: ensure the selected modelBuilder has been initialised/selected
220                // prior to invoking initialise; the current code assumes a single
221                // implementation and therefore no selection step is required. When
222                // adding compositional builder selection insert the selection logic
223                // earlier (for example in the constructor) so that modelBuilder here
224                // refers to the chosen implementation.
225                this.modelBuilder.doInitialiseOutbreak(builder, this.outbreak, sampler);
226                this.outbreak.setCurrentState(builder.build());
227
228                this.outbreak.getPeople().parallelStream().forEach(p -> {
229                        if (p instanceof ModifiablePerson) {
230                                ModifiablePerson m = (ModifiablePerson) p;
231
232                                Sampler sampler2 = Sampler.getSampler(this.outbreak.getUrn());
233
234                                ImmutablePersonState.Builder builder2 = ImmutablePersonState
235                                                .builder();
236                                if (m.initialisedCurrentState()) {
237                                        builder2.from(m.getCurrentState());
238                                }
239
240                                builder2.setEntity(p).setTime(0);
241
242                                // Delegate person initialisation to the selected builder. When
243                                // enabling compositional selection ensure the chosen builder
244                                // implements the combination of DefaultInHost*Initialiser
245                                // interfaces you require (or provide alternatives via
246                                // subclassing the DefaultModelBuilder).
247                                m.setCurrentState(
248                                                this.modelBuilder.doInitialisePerson(builder2, p, sampler2)
249                                );
250
251                        } else
252                                throw new RuntimeException("Not modifiable person");
253                });
254
255        }
256
257        void setupOutbreak(String urnBase) {
258                this.outbreak.setUrn(
259                                (urnBase != null ? urnBase + ":" : "") + this.setupConfig.getName()
260                                                + ":" + this.setupConfig.getReplicate()
261                );
262                Sampler sampler = Sampler.getSampler(this.outbreak.getUrn());
263                // TODO: when builder selection is compositional ensure selection
264                // happens before any builder method is invoked (eg here). For example
265                // if using a factory the factory must be consulted during construction
266                // and `this.modelBuilder` must be the chosen implementation.
267                this.modelBuilder
268                                .doSetupOutbreak(this.outbreak, this.setupConfig, sampler);
269        }
270
271}
